message.description: The US has returned 307 looted treasures to India as part of a 15-year investigation into international trafficking networks, the Manhattan District Attorney's office announced Monday.

message.description: India said it will allow cargoes of white and brown rice backed by letters of credit issued before Sept. 9 to be shipped overseas, a measure that provides some relief to exporters grappling with fresh government curbs.
message.title: India allows rice exports backed by already issued letters of credit - Reuters India

message.description: A security guard stood at either end of a 145-year-old footbridge in the Indian town of Morbi on Sunday evening, blowing whistles and repeatedly asking surging crowds to get off the structure spanning the murky Machchhu river, witnesses said.
message.title: Guards on India bridge struggled to control crowd before collapse, witnesses say - Reuters India

message.description: Indian shares traded higher on Monday, lifted by sharp gains in heavyweight State Bank of India and consumer stocks on robust earnings results.
message.title: INDIA STOCKS Indian shares climb as SBI, consumer stocks boost - Reuters India

message.description: India is in talks with the governments of other countries to export green hydrogen made in the South Asian nation, an official of its foreign ministry said on Thursday.

message.title: India regulator fines MakeMyTrip, Oyo for anti-competitive conduct - Reuters India

message.title: India competition regulator fines Google $161.95 mln for anti-competitive practices - Reuters India

message.description: Indian authorities have asked a court to quash Pernod Ricard's bid to halt proceedings related to a $244 million tax demand, accusing the French spirit giant of being a "habitual litigant" and conspiring to "defraud" the government, legal documents show.
message.title: India says Pernod delaying $244 mln tax demand probe - Reuters India

message.description: Retail inflation is set to ease from September levels, while economic activity is poised to expand, the Reserve Bank of India said in its monthly bulletin published on Monday.

message.title: Singapore Airlines, Tata Group in talks over integration of Vistara and Air India - Reuters India

message.description: India scrapped on Thursday a rule granting voting rights to new residents of its Jammu and Kashmir region after widespread anger among political parties, who labelled it a bid to change the demographics of the country's only Muslim-majority region.
message.title: India axes rule on Kashmir voting rights after political parties' outcry - Reuters India

message.description: India is examining whether there is a need to raise palm oil import taxes, government and trade sources said, as part of efforts by the world's biggest vegetable oil importer to help millions of its farmers reeling from lower oilseed prices.
message.title: India examining proposal to raise palm oil import tax - Reuters India

message.description: India on Wednesday issued an advisory asking all its citizens to avoid travelling to Ukraine, citing the 'deteriorating security situation' in the country.
message.title: India issues advisory asking citizens to avoid travel to Ukraine - Reuters India

message.description: The Reserve Bank of India (RBI) may need to revive open market bond purchases to manage banking system liquidity that is likely to slip into deficit over the next two months, Bank of America strategists wrote in a note on Wednesday.
message.title: India cenbank may need to resume bond buying to manage liquidity deficit -BofA - Reuters India

message.description: Honda Motorcycles and Scooters India plans to launch a flexi-fuel model of motorcycle in India by end-2024, the company's CEO said on Wednesday.
message.title: Honda Motorcycles & Scooters India to launch flexi-fuel model by end-2024 - Reuters India

message.description: Indian authorities have stopped a photojournalist from boarding a flight to the United States, where she had planned to attend a ceremony to receive a Pulitzer Prize.

message.description: Incessant rain lashed parts of northern India on Monday forcing schools to close in several cities as an unusually late rainy season prolonged havoc across the country, and killed 18 people over the past 24 hours.
message.title: Late monsoon brings more misery to north India; 18 dead - Reuters India

message.description: U.N. chief Antonio Guterres on Wednesday sought India's support in mobilising G20 nations to help out developing countries saddled with debt, with three of India's neighbours already seeking IMF loans as their economies struggle.
message.title: UN wants India to mobilise G20 to help debt-stressed countries - Reuters India

message.description: Heavy rainfall has spoiled Indian sugar mills' plans for an early start to cane crushing so raw sugar exports could get underway before supplies start coming on the market from rival exporter Thailand, a senior industry official and dealers said.
message.title: Heavy rains to delay sugar cane crushing in top producer India - Reuters India

message.description: Authorities in India have stopped production of cough syrup at a factory linked to children's deaths in Gambia after they found violations, a state minister told Reuters partner ANI on Wednesday.
message.title: India finds violations at factory linked to Gambia children deaths -state minister - Reuters India

message.description: India's secular character must be preserved and protected, and states must take action to stop hate speeches, the country's top court said on Friday, in response to a petition asking for action on such utterances against the Muslim community.

message.title: UK says has completed most of India trade deal, will only sign once happy - Reuters India

message.description: India continues to favour a self-regulatory body for social media content disputes, a federal minister told Reuters, despite a lack of consensus among Big Tech companies to form a joint appeals panel.
message.title: India remains open to self-regulation of social media content -minister - Reuters India

message.title: Yellen heads to India to draw surging economic power closer to U.S. orbit - Reuters India

message.title: India says Xiaomi misled Deutsche Bank on 'illegal' royalty payments - Reuters India

message.description: India's government is unlikely to offer any tax concessions to attract investors to its first issue of sovereign green bonds, a senior government official told Reuters on Thursday.

message.description: A government panel has approved an application seeking environmental clearance of indigenously developed genetically modified (GM) mustard seeds, experts said, paving the way for commercial use of the country's first GM food crop.

message.description: India is offering 26 oil and gas blocks and 16 coal bed methane blocks in its latest exploration licensing round, according to the country's upstream regulator, as the world's third largest oil consumer seeks to boost local output.

message.description: The Indian rupee ended flat on Monday, while its Asian counterparts dropped on recession fears, as the Reserve Bank of India's likely intervention continued supporting the local currency.

message.description: A free trade agreement between India and Britain will not be done in time for Diwali in late October, two sources in New Delhi told Reuters on Friday, although it was not immediately clear what was causing the delay.

message.description: India should have a moderate divestment target, a top finance ministry official said on Tuesday, pointing to market volatility and investors' shaky appetite for risk.
